p: The mosquitoes were collected in sylvan environments in 1969, identified, and grouped into pools of up to 30 individuals per species per site; samples were stored at –20°C for a maximum of 4 days in the field, transported to the Institut Pasteur in Bangui, and stored at –80°C until virus isolation. The virus was isolated and amplified by four serial passages in suckling mice brain, as described by Saluzzo and colleagues [ 27]. The brain suspensions were then lyophilized and stored in sealed glass vials at room temperature until use.
